properties.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 2:20AM PST until March 1 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
...Sierra travel impacts continue through this morning...

.A weather system continues to bring periods of moderate snowfall
for the Sierra through tomorrow morning. Heaviest snowfall will be
through the early morning hours for elevations above 6000 feet,
with a couple inches of snow possible for elevations down to 4000
feet. Snow showers will continue through noon. Mountain travel
could be difficult with chain controls, reduced visibility due to
gusty winds, and travel delays.

* WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on slippery road conditions.
Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches are expected.

* WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope
Northern Sierra Nevada.

* WHEN...Until noon today.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at
times.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.
The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY ABOVE 6000 FEET
